docs.snippet: LIMA, Peru, Jan. 11.--The United States Amateur Athletic Union basketball team, playing the fifth of a series of matches in Peru, was beaten last night by the local Flecha quintet, 27 to 23, before a crowd of 4,000.
docs.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru, Jan. 11.--The United States Amateur Athletic Union basketball team, playing the fifth of a series of matches in Peru, was beaten last night by the local Flecha quintet, 27 to 23, before a crowd of 4,000.

headline.main: U.S. FIVE LOSES IN PERU; Bows to Flecha Quintet, 27-23, in Hard-Fought Game

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 11.--The Conference of Intellectual Cooperation today defeated Mexico's proposal that all American countries grant free entry and unrestricted distribution for all books and other forms of literature regardless of their...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 11.--The Conference of Intellectual Cooperation today defeated Mexico's proposal that all American countries grant free entry and unrestricted distribution for all books and other forms of literature regardless of their political content.

headline.main: MEXICAN PROPOSAL DEFEATED AT PARLEY; Intellectual Meeting Rejects Free Entry of All Books

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: INTELLECTUAL COOPERATION, AMER CONF OF THE COMMS FOR

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: A threatened strike action against the American Republics Line, which would have held the liner Uruguay at her dock tonight, apparently was averted late last night at a conference of steamship officials and leaders of the National Maritime Union.
docs.lead_paragraph: A threatened strike action against the American Republics Line, which would have held the liner Uruguay at her dock tonight, apparently was averted late last night at a conference of steamship officials and leaders of the National Maritime Union.

headline.main: SHIP STRIKE THREAT SEEN ENDED BY TALK; Liner Uruguay Expected to Sail Tonight After Protest on Composition of Crew CONTRACT HELD VIOLATED Union and Steamship Officials Discuss Interpretation of Pact Made in November

docs.snippet: The Cunard White Star liner Britannic is due to arrive tonight from Liverpool via Cobh. Passengers are Sir Charles Morgan, Mr. and Mrs. John M. Conway, Mrs. John Devine, Sir Herbert Grotrain, P.M. Fowlie and W.W. Dawson.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Cunard White Star liner Britannic is due to arrive tonight from Liverpool via Cobh. Passengers are Sir Charles Morgan, Mr. and Mrs. John M. Conway, Mrs. John Devine, Sir Herbert Grotrain, P.M. Fowlie and W.W. Dawson.
